content.description: Sit start on the right side of the main face. Skip the huge tufa in the cave and gaston on the left side. Set your feet and move upward to a slopey hold and top out.
content.location: The downclimb is in the back.

content.description: Start on the right of the cave, reach right to sidepull, situate your feet, and throw left to hidden slopper.
Start on the gigantic, obvious knob in the cave. Climb left and up onto the face.

Start on the huge jug in the "cave", and move to the left. Instead of getting on the wall, go underneath the boulder and back out on top. The crux is the first move, going from the huge hold to being underneath the rock (while not hitting your head) and not dragging on the ground. From there, move on upward on some good crimps and top out.
content.protection: A pad, if that. This is a LOW ball problem for the first section.
content.location: This is right near Big Ass Boulder at the Wolcott Campgrounds. It is 30 feet to the left of Big Ass Boulder if you're on the road.

content.description:
This is just an extension of

Penalty Game

. Sit start on the far right side and move up the side pulls to the start of

Penalty Game

. Head under the LOW roof and move upward after that. It is way different than anything I've ever tried before.
content.protection: Maybe a pad. It's so low it might actually get in the way.
content.location: This is on the Cave Boulder. There's a downclimb on the back side.

content.description:
Start on the huge jug under the "cave", and move out and right. Use the four small finger pockets with the right hand and move up with the left hand. The four finger pocket is really four one finger holes right beside each other. That's the crux - moving from that hold to the more positive left hand.

The top out is good but filled with bird and rat crap. Just beware.
content.location: Just left of Big Ass Boulder. You can downclimb on the back side really easily.

content.description: Start on the gigantic, obvious knob. Move right to an undercling. Then move up on crimps and slopers.
